creator: pregan@crt.xerox.com
text:
I get the following error when running ejbjar using weblogic 7 :

[ejbc] DEPRECATED: The weblogic.ejbc20 compiler is deprecated and 
will be removed in a future version of WebLogic Server.  Please use 
weblogic.ejbc instead.

Can someone update this to use weblogic.ejbc instead of weblogic.ejb20?

Thanks,
Pat

There is no easy way to determine what version of ejbc to use. If I default to
weblogic.ejbc, version 6 users will have problems. I have decided, therefore, to
leave the current behaviour as is.

If you wish to avoid the warning, set the ejbcclass attribute as follows
    ejbcclass="weblogic.ejbc"
in the <weblogic> element. 

This attribute is supported in Ant 1.4.1 although it was not documented since up
until version 6, <ejbjar> could figure out the correct compiler. I have
documented it now.
creator: conor@apache.org
